result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Defendant to make payment arrangement with the Clerk of Court's office within 10 days of release from jail.  If he fails to do so, fine is due 1/6/16.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel M. Brown

defendant.name: Brown, Daniel M.
defendant.address: P O Box 594, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Defendant plead guilty to the charge.  Court advised the charge and possible penalties of the counts he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.  No joint recommendation.  State recommended 1 year probation.  DNA sample.  No contact with A.B.  or the Hideaway.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. Obtain and maintain employment.  40 hours community service due within first 3 months of probation.  AODA.   If not accepting probation, 30 -45 days jail.  Defense recommended fine and court costs.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered: 20 days jail.  $100, plus costs fine.  Jail to start today.  Set up payment plan withing 10 days of release.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  Ashley Blackcoon.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared without counsel.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  Court advised attorney options to the defendant.  He has attorney.  Robert Gardner.  Defendant entered NGP.  Court entered NGP.  PTC set for 10/28 and STC 11/16/15 at 3 pm. Court advised defendant to contact his attorney so that he files a notice of retainer and can receive notices.

Pre-trial conference at 10-28-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 11-16-2015 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  Ashley Blackcoon.
